conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to determine the direction of the particle's motion from 2 to 3 seconds.
The image is a velocity-time (v-t) graph with a horizontal section from 0 to 2 seconds at 2 m/s, and a diagonal section from 2 to 3 seconds with decreasing velocity.
From 0 to 2 seconds, the velocity is constant at 2 m/s, indicating no change in direction.
From 2 to 3 seconds, the velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s.
Since the velocity is decreasing, the particle's motion direction at 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
The question asks if the motion direction from 2 to 3 seconds is the same as or opposite to the defined positive direction.
Given that the velocity decreases to 0 m/s at 3 seconds, the motion direction is opposite to the positive direction.
